pullRequest.title: fix #2506 Switch to GitHub Actions for CI (PR checks)
pullRequest.bodyText:
validate the workflow
 remove travis.yml
 exclude this repo from scope of TravisCI app in settings
 make the newly introduced checks required in settings

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    arguments: check 
          
          
            
                    arguments: check --no-daemon
          
          
            
                    wrapper-cache-enabled: true
          
          
            
                    dependencies-cache-enabled: true
          
          
            
                    configuration-cache-enabled: true
          
      
    
    
  

The third cache line doesn't bring much, but doesn't hurt either.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+name: PR Check
+on: pull_request
+jobs:
+  gradle:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+    - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+    - uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+      with:
+        java-version: 8
+    - uses: eskatos/gradle-command-action@v1
+      with:
+        arguments: check

nodes.bodyText: Could add name: for readability of steps
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+name: PR Check
+on: pull_request
+jobs:
+  gradle:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+    - uses: actions/checkout@v2

nodes.bodyText: Could rename to build & test on also apply on main branches (with on: push)

commit.message: [polish] Add slow and flakky junit5 tags, see #2506

fix #2506 Switch to GitHub Actions for CI (PR checks)

This commit introduces a PR Check workflow on GitHub Actions, with
several features:

 - accelerate the run by having distinct jobs for slow core tests,
 normal core tests, flakky tests (allowing to re-run tests that are
 tagged `flakky`) and all other tests (including micrometer, benchs,
 reactor-test, ...)
 - workflow will cancel previous runs on the same branch
 - caching enabled

It also adds a `junit-tags` gradle parameter to allow inclusion of
specific JUnit5 tags when running core tests (which is used in the
GHA workflow).

Finally, it removes `.travis.yml` configuration.

See also reactor/reactor#690

Reviewed-in: #2508
Co-authored-by: Eric Bottard <313494+ericbottard@users.noreply.github.com>

afterCommit.message:
fix #2506 Switch to GitHub Actions for CI (PR checks)

This commit introduces a PR Check workflow on GitHub Actions, with
several features:

 - accelerate the run by having distinct jobs for slow core tests,
 normal core tests, flakky tests (allowing to re-run tests that are
 tagged `flakky`) and all other tests (including micrometer, benchs,
 reactor-test, ...)
 - workflow will cancel previous runs on the same branch
 - caching enabled

It also adds a `junit-tags` gradle parameter to allow inclusion of
specific JUnit5 tags when running core tests (which is used in the
GHA workflow).

Finally, it removes `.travis.yml` configuration.

See also reactor/reactor#690

Reviewed-in: #2508
Co-authored-by: Eric Bottard <313494+ericbottard@users.noreply.github.com>
